FuncDef:
The info-center max-logfile-number command sets the maximum number of compressed information files to be stored.
The undo info-center max-logfile-number command restores the default maximum number of compressed information files to be stored. The info-center max-logfile-number command sets the maximum number of compressed information files to be stored. The undo info-center max-logfile-number command restores the default maximum number of compressed information files to be stored. The default maximum numbers of common log files (log.log) and security log files (security.log) are both 200.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of compressed information files to be stored.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 500.

ExtraInfo: The total number of compressed files must be limited in the following cases:
